title: TEST EVALUATION DEVICE AND TEST EVALUATION METHOD
assignee: NTT Inc; NTT Inc USA; Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp
inventors: KASAMATSU MIHO; KOYA HIDETAKA; OISHI HARUO
abstract_clean: A test evaluation device (100) according to an embodiment comprises: a question creation unit (11) that creates questions from which an element to be evaluated by a test is excluded; an evaluation unit (12) that creates a distribution of incorrect answers by comparing an answer result obtained by setting the questions to one or more answerers with the correct answers of the test; and a reliability evaluation unit (13) that acquires a distribution of incorrect answers to the test by an arbitrary answerer, compares the distribution of the incorrect answers to the questions with the distribution of the incorrect answers to the test by the arbitrary answerer, and evaluates the reliability of the result of the answers to the test by the arbitrary answerer.

title: GAMIFIED BUSINESS LEARNING & AI TALENT DISCOVERY PLATFORM FOR KIDS
inventors: HAMZEHPOUR ZAHRA; GHASEMI DAREHNAEE ZEYNAB; SAMIE SOROUSH; MOAZED MAHYAR
abstract_clean: An interactive platform for children aged 6 to 12 that combines gamification and AI to simulate real-life scenarios through educational games. It introduces various professional concepts such as engineering, education, firefighting, policing, finance, and business tailored to each country's specific needs. By employing AI-based behavioral analyses, the platform personalizes each child's learning path, aiding in the identification and development of their individual talents. This approach enables children to acquire essential skills for navigating diverse professional fields and social interactions. Additionally, ItSeemsCool engages parents and educators by providing detailed behavioral insights and talent discovery reports, empowering them to effectively guide children's educational journeys. Motivational features like badges, leaderboards, and AR/VR tools maintain children's engagement, making learning both enjoyable and impactful. Overall, ItSeemsCool offers a comprehensive solution to modern educational challenges by combining professional concept education, gamification, and AI to enhance children's practical and social skills, preparing them for a successful future.

title: THOUGHT TENDENCY EVALUATION DEVICE, METHOD, AND PROGRAM
assignee: NTT Inc; Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp
inventors: KASAMATSU MIHO; KOYA HIDETAKA; OISHI HARUO; NAKAJIMA HAJIME
abstract_clean: In one aspect of the present invention, when a user's thought tendency with respect to a state change process is evaluated, a procedure for creating the state change process is divided into a plurality of stages in accordance with the flow of creation, and for each of the stages, small question data for evaluating the degree of understanding thereof is created. Then, user's answer data to each small question data is acquired, the degrees of the user's understanding for the respective stages are evaluated on the basis of the acquired answer data, and the evaluation results of the degrees of understanding are synthesized to evaluate the user's thought tendency with respect to the procedure for creating the state change process.

title: INNOVATIVE EDUCATIONAL SYSTEM FOR COLLABORATIVE DESIGN, CODING AND ASSEMBLY OF INTERACTIVE PLAY STRUCTURES
inventors: SAFAVI ARASH
abstract_clean: A software program and hardware that act as a creative platform, especially for students and children, to design and construct toys. This system supports incremental building of components into complex structures and integrates with 3D printing technology, allowing users to physically create their designs. It also includes features for adding sensors and motors, enabling interactive and controllable toys through coding.The platform encourages creativity and collaboration by providing tools for organizing and sharing toy designs. It facilitates online coding competitions, where participants can contribute different elements to a collective project, such as designing a city. Users can access a library of pre-made objects, place them on the program's screen, and save their work on a hard drive or cloud service. The system ensures data encryption and regular saving to prevent loss.

abstract_clean: Provided are an online graphical programming system based on Blockly and Raspberry Pi and a method for using same. The system comprises: a Raspberry Pi development board, an external electronic device, a display device, a power supply module, a cloud server, a Blockly-based online graphical programming platform and a client program installed on Raspberry Pi. title: DIGITAL TEACHING MANAGEMENT SYSTEM
inventors: S SELVAMANI
abstract_clean: Digital Teaching Management System. Embodiments herein provide a method and systems for managing digital teaching of an academic curriculum. The method includes determining, by a Content Management (CM) engine (130), course contents related to topics from external sources based on time duration provided for teaching the topics. Further, the method includes modifying, by the CM engine (130), the course contents based on user preference, participant profile and past performance of participants. Further, the method includes generating, by the CM engine (130), notifications if the time duration of topics does not satisfy the pre-defined time duration for teaching the topic in a session. abstract_clean: The present disclosure discloses an interactive system for teaching sequencing and programming to children. In some embodiments, the interactive system comprises a plurality of tiles organisable to form a structural pattern, wherein each tile comprises an RFID tag storing at least a pre-defined command corresponding to a first action and an identifier associated with a second set of actions, and an interactive robot. In some embodiments, the interactive robot when placed on the tile is configured for, receiving a voice command from a user, reading at least the pre-defined command and the identifier from the RFID tag associated with the tile, comparing the command received from the user and the pre-defined command, and performing one or more actions from among a third set of actions based on a result of comparison.

abstract_clean: Systems and methods associated with modular computing environments are provided. For instance, a modular computing environment can include a control entity including one or more processing devices. The modular computing environment can include one or more modular components directly or indirectly coupled to the control entity. The one or more modular components can be configured to receive a module specifying one or more instructions to be performed by an external device. The one or more modular components include one or more processing devices. Each modular component is configured to determine state data associated with the modular component based at least in part on the received module and to provide the state data to the control entity. The state data includes an identification signature of the received module and a configuration context of the modular component within the modular computing environment.

title: MAGNETIC RECEPTIVE SENSOR AND OPTIMIZED DRAWING AND ERASING FOR VERTICALLY DRIVING ROBOT
inventors: DUBROVSKY ZIVTHAN; CHERNEY RAPHAEL; SALLUM HANI; DA SILVA GILLIG JULIAN
abstract_clean: A vertically driving marking robot includes a robot body; at least one magnet constraining the robot to move parallel to a vertical, magnetically responsive surface; a drive configured to displace the robot relative to the surface while the robot is held to the surface; a holder configured to hold a marker; an accelerometer measuring a gravity vector; a computing device in communication with the optical sensors, the accelerometer, and the drive. The computing device includes a processor and computer-readable memory, wherein the computer-readable memory includes non-transitory program code for at least one of the following actions: (a) generating a drift correction to compensate for drive slippage drift in response to and as a function of the gravity vector and (b) commanding the drive to displace the robot along a desired trajectory in response to the drift correction.

title: COGNITIVE MODEL-BASED COMPUTATIONAL THINKING TRAINING METHOD AND DEVICE
inventors: LIU GANG; XING JIN; ZHANG ZHAOQIN; YANG XUAN; JIA WEICHEN; CHEN SHOUFANG
abstract_clean: A cognitive model-based computational thinking training method and device. The method comprises: constructing a training platform for training computational thinking according to a computational thinking cognitive model set by a user (S101); the training platform displaying training data corresponding to the computational thinking cognitive model, acquiring training feedback data of the user for the training data, and working out an evaluation grade for the computational thinking of the user according to the training feedback data and a pre-set rating standard (S102); and performing multi-level fuzzy evaluation on the computational thinking of the user according to the evaluation grade (S103). Abstract thinking ability training and evaluation are performed on a learner through a complete training procedure and evaluation system in the training platform, and the way of thinking of the learner during vocational education can be effectively changed, so as to complete the transformation of talent from a technical operation type to an information processing type.

title: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR PHYSICAL PROGRAMMING ON INTERACTIVE SURFACE
inventors: SHI ZHENG; WANG HUIHUI; DU YAOHONG
abstract_clean: A system and method are provided for physical programming on an interactive surface. The system includes multiple physical programming objects (1) with each object (1) visually marked with a programming symbol; an interactive surface (2) comprising an array of electrodes; a processor (3) operatively linked to the interactive surface (2), configured to detect the magnitude of the capacitive coupling between the physical programming objects (1) placed on the interactive surface (2) and the array of electrodes of the interactive surface (2), and further configured to identify the location information of the physical programming objects (1) as well as finger touch gestures made upon the programmable physical objects (1), and further configured to recognize the IDs of the physical programming objects (1); a first memory unit (4) operatively linked to the processor (3), configured to store correlation relationships among and between the objects' IDs, programming symbols and programming codes; a second memory unit (5) operatively linked to the processor (3), configured to store correlation relationships between the finger touch gestures and the programming logic of the programming symbols. Once the physical programming objects (1) are placed on the interactive surface (2) and a finger touch gesture is made upon the physical programming objects (1), the processor (3) is configured to produce a programming code based on the finger touch gesture and the programming symbols.

abstract_clean: The present invention relates to a content creating system using content curation and a method for same, and to a content creating system using content curation and a method for same which can provide: a system in which content for each issue can be autonomously generated and developed, and a training method using the system. title: INQUIRY SKILLS TUTORING SYSTEM
inventors: GOBERT JANICE D; BAKER RYAN S; SAO PEDRO MICHAEL A
abstract_clean: An assessment engine includes a definition of inquiry skills being assessed. Assessment models are used to infer skill demonstration as one or more students engage in inquiry within computerized simulations and/or microworlds. A pedagogical agent and/or help system provides real-time feedback to one or more students based on the assessment model outputs, and/or based on additional models that track one or more students developing proficiency across inquiry tasks over time. A pedagogical agent and/or help system for science inquiry tutoring responds in real-time on the basis of knowledge-engineered and data-mined assessment and/or tracking models.

title: Conversational programming
inventors: REPENNING ALEXANDER
abstract_clean: Methods and systems for providing rich semantic feedback to programmers by executing programs, or parts of programs, in data contexts relevant to the programmer are provided. According to one embodiment, software code associated with one or more of multiple programming building blocks is enabled to be concurrently edited and executed within a programming environment. A conversational programming agent of the programming environment receives (i) information regarding the programming building blocks and (ii) information indicative of a current situation relating to the programming building blocks. The conversational programming agent evaluates the programming building blocks based on the current situation. Then, detection of one or more logical errors in one or more of the programming building blocks is facilitated by the conversational programming agent proactively providing semantic feedback regarding those of the programming building blocks to which the current situation is relevant to the programmer based on results of the evaluation.

title: Methods and systems for generating completely automated public tests to tell computers and humans apart (CAPTCHA)
inventors: ISAACS GARY
abstract_clean: Methods and Systems for generating a Completely Automated Public Tests to tell Computer and Humans Apart (CAPTCHA) provide a computational puzzle according to a received request. The computational puzzle, which may be for example, a jigsaw puzzle, maze puzzle, composite image of matching and non matching shapes or other type of puzzle, is configured to have a correct solution that is expected to be determinable by a human rather than a computer. For example, the computational puzzle is generated from a plurality of individually randomly generated puzzle features, such as puzzle surface image, image color gradient, puzzle component shape, or other puzzle features. A determination is made as to whether a human as opposed to a machine solved the computational puzzle.

abstract_clean: Embodiments herein generally relate to a method and system using physical toy blocks to perform (e.g., execute) coding tasks. title: MOLECULAR DATA STORAGE USING COST-FREE MOLECULAR LIBRARIES
inventors: ROSENSTEIN JACOB K; RUBENSTEIN BRENDA M; GUMUS SELAHADDIN; BIECHELE-SPEZIALE DANA
abstract_clean: The invention provides the uses of chemical waste and byproducts in a chemical library to store digital information, and methods for computing with unknown waste chemicals by encoding digital data into a plurality of chemicals to obtain a dataset; translating the dataset into a chemical form; reading the data set; querying the dataset by performing an operation to obtain a perceptron; and analyzing the perceptron for identifying change in at least one of the chemicals, thereby developing a chemical computational language. The invention demonstrates a workflow for representing abstract data in synthetic metabolomes. Also presented are several demonstrations of kilobyte-scale image data sets stored in synthetic metabolomes, recovered at >99% accuracy.

title: THREE-DIMENSIONAL MAGNETIC BLOCK SYSTEM AND METHOD
inventors: JENNINGS PAMELA L; BENGTSON ALAN; BACHAALANY ELIAS; MAALOUF IMAD
abstract_clean: Disclosed are methods and systems of blocks with magnets, magnetically-attractive non-magnetic elements, and magnetic detectors. The methods and systems facilitate user attachment and detachment of the blocks to each other and detection of which face of which block is attached to which face of which other block, and in what orientation. The blocks can be comprised of multiple regular convex polyhedra, such as tetrahedrons, cubes, octahedra, dodecahedra, or icosahedra. The faces of the blocks could be equilateral triangles, squares, or regular pentagons. The methods and systems can further comprise a selection pen and system software configured to render the blocks and their attachment to each other on a display.

title: Methods and Systems for Visual Programming using Polymorphic, Dynamic Multi-Dimensional Structures
inventors: PENLAND D JORDAN; LOWERY CHRISTOPHER F; TROGOLO KATHRYN HEPPNER
abstract_clean: A computer-based dynamic multi-dimensional visual programming environment is disclosed in which a visual programming language supports creation, operation, and maintenance of a model of a software system having a spatial arrangement of dynamic, polymorphic structures on a multi-dimensional world, to render the multi-dimensional grid into a display on a two-dimensional computer screen, and to construct, display, and act on instructions from a user interface associated with the two-dimensional screen to manipulate the dynamic, operable, multi-dimensional graphical items on the multi-dimensional grid.

title: INTERACTIVE SYSTEM FOR TEACHING SEQUENCING AND PROGRAMMING
inventors: TUMKUR SRINIVAS SHANMUGHA; KUMAR VIVEK PRADEEP; KUNDULLY JAYAKRISHNAN; KOTHARI RAHUL; JAYARAM RUDRESH; MENON VINEETHA; THULASIRAJU NISCHITHA; JOHNSON JOHN SOLOMON
abstract_clean: The present disclosure discloses an interactive system for teaching sequencing and programming to children. In some embodiments, the interactive system comprises a plurality of tiles organisable to form a structural pattern, wherein each tile comprises an RFID tag storing at least a pre-defined command corresponding to a first action and an identifier associated with a second set of actions, and an interactive robot. In some embodiments, the interactive robot when placed on the tile is configured for, receiving a voice command from a user, reading at least the pre-defined command and the identifier from the RFID tag associated with the tile, comparing the command received from the user and the pre-defined command, and performing one or more actions from among a third set of actions based on a result of comparison.

title: ONLINE PROGRAMMING EDUCATION METHOD AND SYSTEM
assignee: Lile Education And Technology (shanghai) Co Ltd
current_assignee: Lile Education And Technology (shanghai) Co Ltd
inventors: ZHAO LUN
abstract_clean: An online programming education method and system, comprising choosing and acquiring an online course for a piece of knowledge; and completing a programming exercise in relation to the piece of knowledge and, if the completed programming exercise meets a predetermined criterion, proceeding to an online course for another piece of knowledge next to said piece of knowledge. After the user has learnt a piece of knowledge, a programming exercise in relation thereto is provided to ensure that another piece of knowledge next to said piece of knowledge will not be made available unless the completed programming exercise meets a predetermined criterion, i.e., unless the user has mastered the piece of knowledge to some extent. Further, a teacher can use the teacher terminal to answer the user's questions in an online manner, thus enhancing his/her learning efficiency.

title: CODING TRAINING SYSTEM USING DRONE
inventors: SEO KYUNG SIK
abstract_clean: The present invention relates to a coding education system, and more particularly, to a coding education system using a drone which enables to more effectively operate a programming education for controlling a drone. An exemplary embodiment of the present invention provides a coding education system using a drone comprising: a content database for storing coding education contents for a drone; a learning management database for storing information about a coding educatee and a coding educator, information about a registered user registered in association with the coding educatee, information about learning progress for coding educatee, and information about learning result for the coding educatee; a coding education server for managing a corresponding event as an event of the learning progress and the learning result occurs and providing a authoring tool for coding education to use the coding education contents stored in the content database; a user terminal for the registered user; a first educational terminal for the coding educatee; a second educational terminal for the coding educator; and an education site management device installed at a site where the coding education is performed to monitor the site.

title: SYSTEM FOR CO-ORDINATION OF LOGICAL SEQUENCE OF INSTRUCTIONS ACROSS ELECTRONIC DEVICES USING VISUAL PROGRAMMING AND WIRELESS COMMUNICATION
inventors: PALSHIKAR AMOL SUBHASH; MUJUMDAR GIRISH RAMESH
abstract_clean: An orchestration engine provides a technical output across multiple programmable objects such as electronic devices, virtual objects and cloud based services in response to user specified logic. The orchestration engine may be deployed on a mobile computer, a tablet computer, a laptop computer, a desktop computer, a wired or wireless electronic device in the system or on a server computer connected via internet. The orchestration engine is capable of supporting extensibility in order to expand support for similar common interaction methods to newer electronic devices via a plug-in framework by specifying the communication protocol of the new element and its capabilities in a descriptive way via a markup language. The orchestration engine is provided along with a library of drag and drop Visual Programming Language steps required for providing executable computer program steps for specifying a user specified logic by computer language illiterate person.

title: Magnetic Receptive Sensor and Optimized Drawing and Erasing for Vertically Driving Robot
inventors: DUBROVSKY ZIVTHAN A; CHERNEY RAPHAEL GERARD; SALLUM HANI M; DA SILVA GILLIG JULIAN U
abstract_clean: A vertically driving marking robot includes a robot body; at least one magnet constraining the robot to move parallel to a vertical, magnetically responsive surface; a drive configured to displace the robot relative to the surface while the robot is held to the surface; a holder configured to hold a marker; an accelerometer measuring a gravity vector; a computing device in communication with the optical sensors, the accelerometer, and the drive. The computing device includes a processor and computer-readable memory, wherein the computer-readable memory includes non-transitory program code for at least one of the following actions: (a) generating a drift correction to compensate for drive slippage drift in response to and as a function of the gravity vector and (b) commanding the drive to displace the robot along a desired trajectory in response to the drift correction.

title: Inquiry Skills Tutoring System
inventors: GOBERT JANICE D; SAO PEDRO MICHAEL A; BETTS CAMERON GUERRA; BAKER RYAN S
abstract_clean: An assessment engine includes a definition of inquiry skills being assessed. Assessment models are used to infer skill demonstration as one or more students engage in inquiry within computerized simulations and/or microworlds. A pedagogical agent and/or help system provides real-time feedback to one or more students based on the assessment model outputs, and/or based on additional models that track one or more students developing proficiency across inquiry tasks over time. A pedagogical agent and/or help system for science inquiry tutoring responds in real-time on the basis of knowledge-engineered and data-mined assessment and/or tracking models.

title: MECHANICAL COMPUTER WITH REPOSITIONABLE COMPONENTS
inventors: BOSWELL PAUL GARRETT
abstract_clean: A mechanical computing system configured to serve as an aid in learning fundamental aspects of coding. The mechanical computing system including a substrate having a flow path between an upstream portion and a downstream portion, and a plurality of repositionable programming members pivotably coupled to the substrate and configured to guide and interact with units dispensed along the flow path from the upstream portion to the downstream portion, wherein a first programming member is configured to pivot relative to the substrate upon interaction with a unit traversing along the flow path, and wherein a second programming member positioned upstream of the first programming member is configured to pivot relative to the substrate based on feedback from the first programming member.

title: MANIPULABLE BLOCKS THAT TRANSMIT COMMANDS TO OBJECTS OR ANIMATIONS BASED ON THE POSITIONING OF THE MANIPULABLE BLOCKS
inventors: MOODY DON
abstract_clean: Described is a system for controlling an object via multiple multi-sided manipulable objects. The system includes multiple manipulable objects having distinct sides. Each manipulable object includes one or more radio frequency identification (RFID) chips. The system also includes a recipient object and a platform for receiving manipulable objects. The platform comprises a RFID reader which can detect, using the at least one RFID chip in each manipulable object, a position, an orientation, and an order of one or more manipulable objects placed on the platform. The platform is configured for emitting a command to the recipient object corresponding to the position, the orientation, and the order of the one or more manipulable objects placed on the platform.

title: CONVERSATIONAL PROGRAMMING
inventors: REPENNING ALEXANDER
abstract_clean: Methods and systems for providing rich semantic feedback to programmers by executing programs, or parts of programs, in data contexts relevant to the programmer are provided. According to one embodiment, software code associated with one or more of multiple programming building blocks is enabled to be concurrently edited and executed within a programming environment. A conversational programming agent of the programming environment receives (i) information regarding the programming building blocks and (ii) information indicative of a current situation relating to the programming building blocks. The conversational programming agent evaluates the programming building blocks based on the current situation. Then, detection of one or more logical errors in one or more of the programming building blocks is facilitated by the conversational programming agent proactively providing semantic feedback regarding those of the programming building blocks to which the current situation is relevant to the programmer based on results of the evaluation.

title: Video and Pictorial Mathematical Learning Kit and Method
inventors: LEE CANAA
abstract_clean: A kit and method is described for introducing mathematical concepts to children through video tutorials and pictorial flash cards. The video tutorials include visual and auditory stimulation based on instructional and entertaining skits, cinematic representations and similar means to deliver and reinforce concepts. The flash cards correspond to the content of the videos tutorials, and are useful before, during and after the video tutorials for further reinforcement of the provided concepts. The kit and method utilize association and repetition as a basis to teach young children, and to provide physical meaning of basic mathematical concepts without requiring abstract thought or computational thinking therefrom. The kit may be tailored to a given audience by varying the chosen videos and flash cards based on a predefined lesson plan, allowing an instructor or parent to adjust the difficulty level to an appropriate level for a particular child or classroom of children.

title: Systems and methods for performing a task on a material, or locating the position of a device relative to the surface of the material
inventors: RIVERS ALEC ROTHMYER; MOYER ILAN ELLISON
abstract_clean: Systems and methods of the present disclosure relate generally to facilitate performing a task on a surface such as woodworking or printing. More specifically, in some embodiments, the present disclosure relates to mapping the surface of the material and determining the precise location of a tool in reference to the surface of a material. Some embodiments relate to obtaining and relating a design with the map of the material or displaying the current position of the tool on a display device. In some embodiments, the present disclosure facilitates adjusting, moving or auto-correcting the tool along a predetermined path such as, e.g., a cutting or drawing path. In some embodiments, the reference location may correspond to a design or plan obtained from obtained via an online design store.

title: Three-dimensional magnetic block system and method
inventors: JENNINGS PAMELA L; BENGTSON ALAN; BACHAALANY ELIAS; MAALOUF IMAD
abstract_clean: Disclosed are methods and systems of blocks with magnets, magnetically-attractive non-magnetic elements, and magnetic detectors. The methods and systems facilitate user attachment and detachment of the blocks to each other and detection of which face of which block is attached to which face of which other block, and in what orientation. The blocks can be comprised of multiple regular convex polyhedra, such as tetrahedrons, cubes, octahedra, dodecahedra, or icosahedra. The faces of the blocks could be equilateral triangles, squares, or regular pentagons. The methods and systems can further comprise a selection pen and system software configured to render the blocks and their attachment to each other on a display.

title: Maternity care teaching system
inventors: Zhang jing-yi; SU YOU-YING; SU PIN-YU
abstract_clean: A pregnant woman care teaching system includes a learning end device, and a teaching server including a storage device and a processor. The storage device stores a plurality of pregnant woman event data, each of which includes a plurality of physiological value information and a plurality of treatment information. The teaching server provides one of the pregnant woman event data to the learning end device as a simulated treatment event and receives an operation instruction generated by it. When the teaching server receives a detection request of the operation instruction, the processor transmits the corresponding physiological value information to the learning end device and displays it, and further waits for a treatment request of the operation instruction from the learning end device. When the teaching server receives a distress request of the operation instruction, the processor terminates the simulated treatment event.

title: Computational thinking learning system that can track learning behavior in real time
inventors: HUANG YUE-MIN; WANG SHI-CHENG
abstract_clean: This creation is about a computational thinking learning system that can track learning behaviors in real time. It mainly includes a visual programming platform for teacher systems and student systems to be connected through the Internet. In the visual programming platform, there are It provides a computational thinking course system for students to systematically participate in online courses, and a real-time learning behavior tracking system that records and analyzes all operations of the student system during the course learning process. Through this, students’ thinking patterns and creative behaviors in the course can be understood through analysis. This allows teachers to provide assistance or adjust course content to students of different levels to improve learning efficiency.

title: Number marker tabletop game set
inventors: CHEN MING-JUN; ZHUANG ZHU-HAN
abstract_clean: This creation is a number marking board game set, including multiple question cards and at least one answer card. Each question card is a rectangular card and marked with a different number. Each number corresponds to a tally symbol. The answer card is rectangular. The cards are marked with a marking column, which is used to mark the numbering symbols, and the question cards are stacked on one side of the answer sheet; thus, it is possible for preschool children not to describe and read through words Then you will be able to recognize the counting chips and understand the concept of horizontal and vertical placement, so that you can use the counting chips to place the correct numbers and learn to count in decimal places.

title: Decimal tabletop game set
inventors: CHEN MING-JUN; ZHUANG ZHU-HAN
abstract_clean: This creation is a decimal board game set, including a game cloth, multiple task cards and multiple board game cards. The game cloth is rectangular and marked with a card pile area and a cumulative card storage area. The cumulative card storage area is located in the card pile area. Each task card is a rectangular card with a number marked on one side, and each task card is stacked on one side of the game cloth. Each board game card is a rectangular card, and one side of each board game card is marked with a corresponding number. Counting icons with different numbers, each board game card is stacked in the accumulative card storage area; through this, preschool children can recognize the digits of ones, tens and hundreds without having to describe and read text And the concept and corresponding position of thousands digit.

title: Chessboard game set
inventors: CHEN MING-JUN; ZHUANG ZHU-HAN
abstract_clean: This creation is a board game set, including a game cloth, plural question cards and plural chess pieces. The game cloth is rectangular and marked with a path. The path is composed of plural grids, and each grid marks a number. Rectangular cards with an addition formula marked on one side, each title card stacked on one side of the game cloth, each chess piece has a different appearance and is placed in any grid position; thereby, preschool children can not Through text description and reading, one can understand and apply basic addition concepts in the game, so as to pave the way for future learning of mathematical operations and use them in daily life.

title: Stacking board game set
inventors: CHEN MING-JUN; ZHUANG ZHU-HAN
abstract_clean: This creation is a stacking board game set, including a plurality of building blocks and a plurality of question cards. Each building block is stacked with each other and marked with at least one number. Each question card is a rectangular card and marked with a subtraction formula. Each question card is stacked. On one side of these building blocks; in this way, preschool children can understand and use the basic concept of subtraction in the game without having to describe and read through words, so as to pave the way for future learning of mathematical operations and use them in in daily life.

title: Direction board game set
inventors: CHEN MING-JUN; ZHUANG ZHU-HAN
abstract_clean: This creation is a directional board game set, including a game cloth, a one-step counting dice, a command dice and multiple player chess pieces. The game cloth is marked with a plurality of grids arranged in an array, and these grids include at least one point grid and one end grid , the step number dice have multiple marked faces, and each marked face is respectively marked with a different number. The command dice has multiple marked faces, and each marked face is marked with a different command icon respectively. A front side and a rear side with different and opposite configurations; by this, preschool children can understand the concepts of forward, reverse, front, back, left, and right directions without having to describe and read through words, thereby used in daily life.

title: LOGIC GAME STRUCTURE
inventors: CHU CHING-CHI; Lu kai-wen; HSIEH FU-CHENG
abstract_clean: A logic game structure is disclosed. The logic game structure is adapted to guide a plurality of scrollable objects to roll, including: a substrate, a plurality of track elements, an input accommodation portion, and an output accommodation portion. The substrate defines an upper half area, a lower half area and an operation area. The operation area is disposed between the upper half area and the lower half area. The plurality of track elements are respectively operably arranged on the substrate and can be connected to each other. The input accommodation portion is disposed in the upper half area, and adapted to accommodate and release the plurality of scrollable objects. The output accommodation portion is disposed in the lower half area and linked with the input accommodation portion, and adapted to show an output result. With the logic game structure, the users can learn operational thinking.

title: Light sensing robot device
inventors: Yang wen-qi; XIAO YUN
abstract_clean: The present invention relates to a light-sensitive robot device. The main structure of the light-sensitive robot device includes a circuit device, a communication module provided on the circuit device, at least one moving element, an instruction guiding module, and at least one color sensor , A plurality of distance sensors, and a power supply device. With the above-mentioned structure, when the light-sensitive robot device is moving, the user can connect the information of the mobile device to the above-mentioned circuit device, thereby controlling and adjusting the light-sensitive robot device, and when the light-sensitive robot device is about to touch an obstacle, The distance sensor on the circuit device will send a signal to the command guiding module, and the command guiding module will stop moving the components to avoid the light-sensitive robotic device colliding with the obstacle. In this way, the convenience of manipulation and adjustment can be improved, and at the same time, damage to the light-sensitive robot device due to collision can be avoided.

title: Instructional tool for learning computational thinking of bubble sort

abstract_clean: This is an instructional tool for learning computational thinking of bubble sort, including a pushing stick, which contains handle and frames. The plate contains a notch for sequence numbers, which has geometric shape of notches as much as the number tokens set in front of, and a notch for placing the marble. title: METHOD FOR LEARNING ABOUT COMPUTAITONAL THINKING ABLE TO TRACK LEARNING BEHAVOIRS IN REAL TIME
inventors: HUANG YUEH MIN; WANG SHIH CHENG
abstract_clean: The present invention relates to a method for learning about computational thinking able to track learning behaviors in real time, which primarily allow a teacher system and a student system to be wireless linked to a visual program design platform on which teachers and students may attend to online computational thinking courses. The method includes steps that students take a pre-test before attending to a course, students and teachers attend to the course via the teacher and student systems, all the operational history data of the student system rendered during the course are recorded by a system for real-time tracking of learning behaviors, students further take a post-test after finishing the course, and at last all the students’ operational and behavioral history data and information of the students’ pre-test and post-test data are analyzed to determine the students’ thinking models as used in the course. Accordingly, teachers enable to properly assist students with different learning aptitude in learning the course or adjust the content of the course, by analysis and determination of students’ creative behaviors, in order to promote students’ leaning efficiency.

title: Methods and systems for preventing and controlling Internet fraud
inventors: HU ZHENG-JIA
abstract_clean: The present invention provides a method for preventing and controlling Internet fraud, which includes: collecting information from multiple user devices. The first communication data placed; parsing the first communication data to obtain first information, the first information being associated with the user information of the user devices; parsing the first communication data to obtain second information, the The second information is related to the network information used by the user devices; based on the first information and the second information, the third communication data used in the fraud method is determined. Based on the method of the present invention, the user information of the fraudster can be predicted from a large amount of communication data when fraud does not occur, or the user information of the fraudster can be found from digital traces, so as to effectively prevent fraud or sanction the fraudster. .

title: METHOD, COMPUTER PROGRAM PRODUCT, AND COMPUTER READABLE MEDIUM OF USING TACTILE ROBOT TO ASSIST COMPUTATIONAL THINKING COURSE
inventors: HSIEH SHENG WEN; Wu min ping
abstract_clean: The present invention relates to a method, a computer program product, and a computer readable medium of using tactile robot to assist computational thinking course. Firstly, a tactile robot including a thematic learning module or a cooperative learning module is provided. The tactile robot provides a learning information of a computational thinking course according to any of visual feedback, auditory feedback, tactile feedback, and kinesthetic feedback. In the computational thinking course, a thematic learning method and a cooperative learning method corresponding to the thematic learning module and the cooperative learning method, respectively, is selectively employed. A server provides the tactile robot with a first computational thinking test information before the computational thinking course, and a second computational thinking test information after the computational thinking course; then, the tactile robot returns a first and second computational thinking messages corresponding to the first and second computational thinking test information, respectively; after that, the server compares the difference between the first and second computational thinking messages and outputs a computational thinking learning outcome information. In this way, the learning effectiveness of the computation thinking course can be improved.

abstract_clean: The present invention is related to the teaching material that enables visually impaired individuals to learn block-based coding; feature; In the teaching material, there is a box (1) designed from photoblock, slots (4) on the box where the starting block (2) and Braille alphabet code blocks (3) will be placed, at least one card reader (5) that detects the accuracy of the placed blocks, at least one where the codes are loaded. An electronic smart circuit board (7), at least one sound module (8) that processes the sound, at least one speaker (6) that allows the sound to be heard from outside, and cables are used to create connections. The visually impaired individual chooses the topic in the teaching material. Then, he takes the Braille alphabet starting block (2) and places it in the slot (4) where the blocks mounted on the box (1) will be placed. The card reader (5) located under the slots (4) detects the block and the explanation on the subject takes place. The disabled individual who hears the sounds coming from the speaker (6) is given instructions on what to do next. According to these instructions, Braille alphabet code blocks (3) are taken and placed in their slots (4) in an order. In this way, the individual both performs block-based coding and is characterized by providing the opportunity to learn the subject.

title: Education design for developing AI literacy for non-majors
inventors: YANG MOONHO
abstract_clean: The present invention relates to a method for designing an education curriculum for fostering AI literacy-based technology convergence problem-solving capabilities for learners who are non-IT majors but have low technology utilization and accessibility in job situations. The first half of the education is structured to provide AI-related theories such as data science, ethical approaches, understanding AI, and learning AI data, as well as AI literacy and humanities literacy such as the impact of AI technology on humans and society and how humans and AI coexist. The second half of the education is structured to provide AI education content centered on experience, moving away from the existing theoretical AI application education such as AI learning data creation practice and various AI application practice. abstract_clean: The present invention relates to an educational robot and, more specifically, to an educational robot for performing a mission while driving a fixed track. According to the present invention, the educational robot performs a plurality of missions while driving a track institution a mission section and comprises: a motor; a wheel rotated by a driving force of the motor; an operation control unit controlling operation of the motor; a sensor unit recognizing a mission code disposed on the track; a mission control unit loading mission data matched with the mission code recognized through the sensor unit from a memory; an output unit outputting the mission data loaded by the mission control unit in audio and video; and a wireless communication unit wirelessly transmitting the mission data loaded by the mission control unit to a paired user terminal. title: Study system and method for coding education
inventors: SANGMIN NO; SUNGHWAN CHOI
abstract_clean: The present invention relates to a learning system for coding education, in which a user calculates a moving path of a robot, and the robot sequentially sets moving order, suggests a question to the user, and moves in accordance with a solution, such that the user naturally understands and learns coding through play, and a learning method thereof. According to the present invention, the learning system for the coding education comprises: the robot moving in accordance with the set order; a server unit uploading the questions; and a control unit enabling the user to sequentially set the moving order of the robot and linked with the server unit to suggest the question to the user in each order, wherein the robot executes the next set movement when the user solves the question suggested in the corresponding order. Moreover, the learning method comprises: an operation step of allowing the user to use to sequentially set the moving order of the robot; a question solving step of allowing the user to solve the problem received from the server; and a moving step of allowing the robot to perform the movement of the next set order when the user suggests a correct answer and wait for the correct answer or cancel the previous movement when the user does not suggest the correct answer.

Hyperspectral imaging offers considerable potential in remote sensing applications, especially for land cover and land-use classification, due to its capacity to acquire extensive spectral data. abstract_clean: The current invention refers to a novel method for developing an “Algorithm for Kath Kuni architecture using Gen AI.” The state-of-the-art framework ensures that with the introduction of new building techniques and the aid of tools, such as Data Science & Gen - Artificial Intelligence (AI), architects may push the limits of efficiency and creativity, automate tedious processes, and investigate novel workflows as AI takes on more analytical and generative roles. Because India is home to a plethora of traditional knowledge and heritage buildings that have been constructed over ages to suit local climates and lifestyles, this invention specifically focused on India is pertinent. The AI-driven design frequently puts efficiency and contemporary aesthetics first, which may ignore or misunderstand the cultural components. Instead of only using conventional solutions, it is crucial to investigate how AI may incorporate or respect vernacular design principles and cultural legacy in the Indian setting by investigating its integration at the early stages of the architectural design process. The aim of this invention is to look into how AI training models can be used in architectural design processes to create and refine spatial designs that meet Indian cultural norms. The Kath Kuni vernacular architecture of the upper hills of Himachal Pradesh has been selected as the pilot. In order to accomplish this goal, the research approach is organized into several phases. A thorough investigation of various AI modalities and their potential to produce architectural spaces that incorporate cultural components is the first step. This involves evaluating training models for picture production and how well they iterate ideas based on vernacular principles. In parallel, the invention/research looks at; (i) how AI is incorporated into architectural workflows, highlighting current patterns, difficulties, and chances to try out novel approaches? (ii) to comprehend how cultural components are organically incorporated into design methods, traditional architectural techniques are examined in addition to AI-focused studies? This includes analysing image-generation training models and their effectiveness in iterating designs based on vernacular principles. Simultaneously, the invention/research study examines existing AI integration in architectural workflows, identifying current trends, challenges, and opportunities for experimentation with new methodologies. Alongside AI-focused analysis, traditional architectural processes are studied to understand how cultural elements are naturally embedded in design practices. The proposed input parameters and components are mapped to the equation developed. The SFO structure for Generative AI Design framework is proposed. The outcome of this invention is a typology of AI-driven design workflows that combine machine intelligence and human creativity to produce original and creative architectural solutions. Thus, based on the Function (F) - how the system works, which includes encoding inputs, Generative Loop, Iterative Optimization, and the Outputs (O) defined as deliverables and performance metrics, the accuracy score of 94% is achieved with validation set based on function, form and climate response.

abstract_clean: With the addendum of huge number of social media platforms along with the epidemic growth of Internet has offered ample number of opportunities for people to share their views and perspectives about any subject of interest including but not limited to educational services, politics, products purchased online, movies and a lot more. Sentiment analysis is a promising research domain that lends itself to analyzing the people?s opinion regarding various topical issues. Aspect-based sentiment analysis is a fine-grained approach to analyze the sentiments expressed at the aspect level rather than a coarse-grained analysis of sentiments associated with the entire review or review sentences. While on most of the occasions the aspects are explicitly specified by the users, in some situations they are hidden(implicit) in the review text which is very challenging to detect. In this context, one of the innovative ideas proposed in this patent is the design of a set of algorithms using computational thinking to carry out explicit aspect extraction and implicit aspect detection. Detecting implicit aspects is very crucial to improve the efficiency of the overall aspect extraction task. By detecting maximum number of explicit and implicit aspects, it is possible to carry out sentiment orientation detection for all identified aspects that contributes to a reasonable improvement in the accuracy of the aspect-based sentiment analysis task. Yet another innovative idea of this proposal is the design of an ennead scale for measuring the sentiment strength of the opinion expressed about the detected aspects. The proposed ennead scale is designed based on the degree of intensification associated with the intensifiers that usually collocate with the opinion words. These innovative ideas proposed for patent are very promising and indispensible for an efficient implementation of aspect ? based sentiment analysis.

abstract_clean: This innovation helps to teach minor children about safe and un-safe touch that can help children be aware of what is happening to them and confront the abuser. Safety issues for women and children arise from the rise in child sexual abuse and harassment in the modern society. The physical and sexual abuse against innocent and vulnerable children keeps increasing. When not educated about the differences between good touch and bad touch, children do not even understand that what is happening to them is wrong. They are unsure about the physical boundaries that they must maintain while interacting with different people. While there may be different cultural norms and customs around hospitality and socialization, the fundamental distinction between good and bad touch is universal. Many such incidents go unnoticed due to the stigma associated with societal judgment. In such cases, knowing the signs of sexual abuse can help give voice to children to fight against the perpetrator and call out their act. The toy thus finds its profound value in educating children about the good and bad touch, promoting cultural ethos, promoting awareness, breaking barriers for children to learn, and educating sexual awareness. The toy detects whether the touch is good or bad by emitting a sound ("SAFE TOUCH" or "UN-SAFE TOUCH"). It also vibrates to represent bad touch, and has a green LED light for good touch and a red LED light for bad touch. This makes it a useful tool for teaching visually impaired, auditory, and speech impaired children about safe and un-safe and bad touch.

The residential, commercial, and industrial sectors can utilize the technologies of the Internet of Things (IoT) to manage energy consumption better. This paper presents a low-cost, open-source, and reliable Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system for home monitoring and control system. The presented SCADA system consists of analog sensors, ESP32, Node-RED, and Message Queuing Telemetry Transport (MQTT) through local Wi-Fi to remotely access and control appliances. This system helps the users to monitor various conditions in the home, such as temperature, humidity, pressure, and light intensity. Thus, users can remotely monitor various devices such as lights, fans, heating/cooling systems, make decisions based on the feedback of sensors. One of the most important goals in today's complex environment is to determine the emotions of others by observing their faces. In the near future, all electronic devices will be controlled by a virtual assistant. This will require increased security measures, but will be easy to access. This project will apply facial recognition technologies to safeguard the virtual assistant. The architecture guarantees that only authorised users can issue voice instructions. Consequently, we can safeguard the AI from danger. You can request about the current time, date, and weather, among other things, in a customer service email. This virtual assistant can be used to send emails by just giving it instructions. Also, it may record our chats and keep them confidential. The user who has not yet been authorised to use the service can register for it, but the system administrator must first allow them permission to do so. It can exchange photos and documents in response to spoken directions. We can instruct it to use the camera by providing instructions. Several members of the same household can utilise the digital assistant thanks to facial recognition.

abstract_clean: With the rapid technological development of society brought on by Artificial Intelligence (AI), the demand for AI- literate workers will increase in the future. It is critical to develop the next generation?s AI competencies and educate them about how to work with and use AI. Previous studies on AI were predominantly focused on secondary and university education; however, research on the Artificial Intelligence curriculum in early childhood education is scarce. Due to the lack of conformity on the standardisation of AI curriculum for early childhood education, this study examines the AI curriculum for kindergarten children using the framework which consists of four key components, including (1) aims, goals, objectives, or declarations of outcome, (2) subject matter, domains, or content, (3) methods or procedure, (4) evaluation and assessment. We recommend that AI literacy be achieved by three competencies: AI Knowledge, AI Skill, and AI Attitude. The employment of a social robot as a learning companion and programmable artifact was proven to be helpful in assisting young children in grasping AI principles. We also discovered which teaching methods had the most greatest influence on students? learning. We recommend problem-based learning for future AI education based on the findings.

title: Upgrading method of module robot
inventors: YING HONG

title: Evaluation method of graphical programming product
inventors: WU MINGHUI; WU HAO; JIN CANGHONG
abstract_clean: The invention provides an evaluation method of graphical programming works based on graph embedding and program complexity, which comprises the steps of establishing an abstract syntax tree aiming at a source code file of the works, obtaining a graph vector of the syntax tree through graph embedding, and taking the graph vector similarity of the works and reference works as a logical characteristic; calculating workload characteristics by adopting a Halstead measurement method; calculating complexity characteristics by adopting an McCabe measurement method; obtaining key variable and task-independent statistic of the work through static matching extraction; and inputting the characteristics and teachers as characteristics into a downstream classifier for classification, and calculating the grade of the work. The invention introduces logical characteristics, which is suitable for the condition that the answer is not unique; the method has the advantages that the characteristics of multiple dimensions such as logicality, workload, complexity, teachers, key variables and task-independent statistics are considered, and the innovation problem and the encouragement problem existing in graphical programming are solved in a certain procedure, so that the scoring can accurately reflect the actual level of students.

title: Material object programming system supporting program decomposition and reuse
assignee: Institute of Automation of Chinese Academy of Science
current_assignee: Institute of Automation of Chinese Academy of Science
inventors: WANG DANLI; JIN QIAO
abstract_clean: The invention belongs to the field of human-computer interaction, particularly relates to a physical programming system supporting program decomposition and multiplexing, and aims to solve the problems that the conventional physical programming system does not support the decomposition and multiplexing of programs, and is high in programming difficulty and low in efficiency. The system of the invention comprises: the system comprises a plurality of object programming blocks, a plurality of display units and a plurality of display units, wherein the object programming blocks are respectively provided with corresponding program semantic identifiers and are arranged to carry out object representation of a program; a plurality of map components, including a planar map component and/or a stereoscopic map component, for constructing a planar and/or stereoscopic travel map; a plurality of program fragment components for setting corresponding program semantic identifiers; and the robot constructs and runs the program semantic programs corresponding to the multiple real object programming blocks, and if the program fragment components placed in the traveling map are read, the corresponding programs are executed. The invention supports the decomposition, the recurrence, the multiplexing and the recombination of the program segments by decomposing the program segments for programming, reduces the difficulty of programming and debugging and improves the programming efficiency.

title: Learning method and system for intelligent education student end

title: Chip for pulse neural network memory calculation and calculation method
inventors: WANG YUAN; ZHAO ZHAO; QIAO XIN
abstract_clean: The embodiment of the invention provides a chip and a calculation method for pulse neural network memory calculation, wherein the chip comprises a signal input module, a memory calculation module and a signal output module which are sequentially connected; the signal input module is used for converting the input image pixel array into a biological pulse signal and inputting the biological pulse signal to the memory computing module; the memory computing module is used for performing memory operation on the biological pulse signal according to a pre-stored neural network synapse weight value and inputting the output bit line current to the signal output module; the signal output module is used for converting the bit line current into an identification pulse signal. The chip and the calculation method for the pulse neural network memory calculation, provided by the embodiment of the invention, integrate the advantages of brain-like calculation and memory calculation, break through the calculation bottleneck of the von Neumann architecture by integrating the functions of on-chip training, on-chip storage and on-chip reasoning, thereby realizing low-power consumption calculation integrating storage and calculation, realizing adjustable output precision and effectively improving the calculation performance.

title: Honeycomb labyrinth shortest path calculation method and honeycomb labyrinth practical training system
inventors: YU ZEFAN; HE XUEZHI; LIU XIAOYANG; LIU ZIWEI
abstract_clean: The invention discloses a honeycomb maze shortest path calculation method and a honeycomb maze practical training system, wherein each node of a honeycomb maze is used as a unit structure body, all nodes adjacent to each node are numbered, and pointers of the adjacent nodes are stored in the unit structure body of the node; reading data of nodes and edges, storing the data in an adjacent matrix form, and counting the number of the nodes and the number of the edges; in the process of the adjacent matrix operation, all the other connection points are set as maximum values after each node traverses the adjacent node; acquiring node information of a starting node, a destination node and each intermediate node; the shortest distance from the starting point to the end point through these intermediate nodes is calculated by dijkstra's algorithm. The invention solves the problem that the honeycomb labyrinth shortest path algorithm cannot be realized in a low-configuration singlechip, adopts an efficient algorithm in a low-cost hardware environment, can be used for various education training products, and obviously reduces the product cost.

title: Automatic address selection method for unmanned aerial vehicle base station
assignee: Guangxi Hualan Geotechnical Engineering Co ltd
current_assignee: Guangxi Hualan Geotechnical Engineering Co ltd
inventors: WEI JINZHAN; LU YUNAN; CHEN MINGHUI; ZHU ZHAOMIN; WU NING; LU WEICHUN
abstract_clean: The invention discloses an automatic address selection method for an unmanned aerial vehicle base station, which comprises the following steps: A. respectively extracting the centers of the areas needing service as service points; B. constructing the maximum outsourcing graph of the plurality of service points in the step A; C. dividing the maximum outsourcing graph into N target areas according to the number N of base stations designed as required; D. solving a central point for service points contained in the N target areas and constructing a Thiessen polygon; E. determining a target point falling into the Thiessen polygon as a reference; F. and E, solving the center point of the service point determined in the step E again, and reconstructing the Thiessen polygon until the position of the solved center point is unchanged. The automatic unmanned aerial vehicle base station site selection method can realize the solution of the optimal solution selected by multiple unmanned aerial vehicle base stations, has the characteristics of rigorous mathematical theory and simple and feasible technology, and is very suitable for selecting the multiple unmanned aerial vehicle base stations in large-range complex environments.

title: Spatial interpolation method based on reverse computing thinking
assignee: Chuzhou Space Intelligent Technology Co ltd; Chuzhou University
current_assignee: Chuzhou Space Intelligent Technology Co ltd
inventors: ZHAO MINGWEI; Ju Xiaoxiao; JIANG LING; WANG CHUN; YANG CANCAN; XU YAN
abstract_clean: The invention discloses a space interpolation method based on reverse computing thinking, and belongs to the technical field of space interpolation model construction. Based on the self-correlation law of the space object, the invention reversely and mentally provides a constraint equation between a sampling point and an unknown grid point and a constraint equation between the grid point and a grid point, and solves the equations by a preprocessing conjugate gradient method and a least square principle to obtain an interpolation attribute value of the grid point. The method comprehensively considers the influence of the sampling points on the grid points and the grid points, solves the problem that in a traditional classic interpolation method, when the number of the sampling points is small, the influence range of a single sampling point is large, and greatly improves the spatial interpolation precision.

title: Optimized drawing and erasing of magneto-receptive sensors and vertical travel robots
inventors: Zifson Dubrovskiy; Rafael Cerny; Hani Salum; Julian Da Silva Gillig
abstract_clean: A vertical travel marking robot comprising: a robot body; at least one magnet that constrains the robot to move parallel to a vertical magnetically responsive surface; a drive configured to displace the robot relative to the surface while the robot is held to the surface; a holder configured to hold a marker; an accelerometer that measures a gravity vector; a computing device in communication with an optical sensor, the accelerometer, and the driver. The computing device comprises a processor and a computer-readable memory, wherein the computer-readable memory comprises non-transitory program code for at least one of: (a) generating a drift correction in response to and in accordance with the gravity vector to compensate for drive slip drift; and (b) command the drive to shift the robot along a desired trajectory in response to the drift correction.

title: Computational thinking evaluation system based on probability model
inventors: FENG JUN; WU HAO; YANG FAN; HE KAIQIANG
abstract_clean: The invention provides a probabilistic model-based computational thinking evaluation system, which comprises a test module and an evaluation module, wherein the test module comprises 7 test sub-modules, and the 7 test sub-modules comprise a computational complexity sub-module, an abstraction sub-module, a simplification sub-module, a design sub-module, a sequencing sub-module, a search sub-module and an evaluation sub-module. The invention tests the comprehensive abilities of abstraction, design and the like, reflects the level of the calculated thinking of the testee in the whole test group through the score, combines the game and the test, has various test forms and wide applicable groups, and accurately obtains the final score of the calculated thinking by utilizing a probability integral model.

title: Chinese medicinal material attribute feature coding and searching system based on Chinese pharmacology theory
inventors: DING CHANGSONG; HUANG XINDI; LIANG HAO; PENG QINGHUA; LI XIN; LI XIAOZHI; DENG LE; LI PENG
abstract_clean: The invention discloses a Chinese medicinal material attribute feature coding and searching system based on a Chinese medicinal theory. The system comprises: the data preprocessing module is used for extracting the attribute characteristics of each Chinese medicinal material in the stored Chinese medicinal text information to form data elements corresponding to each Chinese medicinal material; the database module is used for constructing a structured data table based on data elements corresponding to the traditional Chinese medicinal materials to form a traditional Chinese medicinal material attribute characteristic database; the encoding module is used for encoding each Chinese medicinal material in the Chinese medicinal material attribute characteristic database into 8-layer 15-digit decimal number codes according to the attribute characteristics; and the retrieval module is used for converting the search content into codes of corresponding attribute feature types to send out a query request and outputting a query result. The Chinese medicinal material attribute feature coding and searching system based on the Chinese medicinal theory can realize simplified coding of Chinese medicinal material property, efficacy and other feature attributes, thereby facilitating the representation and formula analysis of Chinese medicinal material feature attributes.

title: Spatio-temporal data immersive visual analysis method based on multilayer associated network

title: Automatic evaluation method and system based on directed acyclic graph and topological sorting
assignee: Beijing Judaoyouda Network Technology Co ltd
current_assignee: Beijing Judaoyouda Network Technology Co ltd
inventors: YU HAORAN; YANG BOYANG; YANG BIN
abstract_clean: The invention relates to an automatic evaluation method and system based on directed acyclic graph and topological sorting. The method comprises the steps that a directed acyclic graph is formed by logical nodes and the directional relation between the logical nodes, topological ordering is carried out on the directed acyclic graph, and a solution set is generated; and traversing and comparing the result sequence submitted by the user with the solutions in the solution set to obtain a final result. The system comprises an information generation subsystem, a foreground interaction subsystem and a logic verification subsystem. The user can use the system to generate elements in the process of mathematic proof and deduction, realize large-scale online detection of logical thinking tightness and deductive reasoning ability of the learner, and simultaneously acquire the problems encountered by the learner in the process of deduction. The invention provides a high-efficiency, simple and easy-to-use teaching tool for teaching workers, and simultaneously provides a strong-interactivity and interesting information interaction and learning platform for learners, thereby training the computational thinking of users more effectively.

title: Cognitive model-based computational thinking training method and device
inventors: LIU GANG; ZHANG ZHAOQIN; YANG XUAN; JIA WEICHEN; CHEN SHOUFANG
abstract_clean: The invention discloses a cognitive model-based computational thinking training method and device. The method includes the following steps that: a training platform for training computational thinking is constructed according to a computational thinking cognitive model set by a user; the training platform displays training data corresponding to the computational thinking cognitive model, acquires training feedback data of the user for the training data, and evaluates the grade of the computational thinking of the user according to the training feedback data and preset evaluation criteria; and multi-level fuzzy evaluation is performed on the computational thinking of the user. According to the cognitive model-based computational thinking training method and device of the invention, abstract thinking ability training and evaluation are performed on learners through complete training procedures and evaluation systems in the training platform, and therefore, the ways of thinking of the learners in vocational education can be effectively changed, and the transformation of technical operation type talents to information processing type talents can be completed.

title: Physical layer multicast and multithread transmission method based on combined block triangularization
assignee: University of Science and Technology of China USTC
current_assignee: University of Science and Technology of China USTC
inventors: XU XIAODONG; ZHANG ZILONG
abstract_clean: The invention discloses a physical layer multicast and multithread transmission method based on combined block triangularization. The physical layer multicast and multithread transmission method is characterized in that a block diagonal precoding matrix of a physical layer multicast wireless scene suitable for a single launching base station and two receiving users is iterated and constructed through a combined triangularization decomposition algorithm by using of a matrix block computational thinking. Compared with an existing combined triangularization decomposition algorithm, the physical layer multicast and multithread transmission method based on the combined block triangularization can not only reduce reduce floating-point multiplication times participating in computing when the block diagonal precoding matrix is used for data transmission, but also obtain better system error code performance, is suitable for is suitable for an environment of receive-transmit antenna of a large scale and a frequency selectivity fading wireless communication channel in a system, and can be conveniently implemented in a new-generation broadband wireless and mobile communication system using a multiple-input-multiple-output technique.

title: MAGNETIC RECEPTIVE SENSOR AND OPTIMIZED DRAWING AND ERASING FOR VERTICALLY DRIVING ROBOT
inventors: DUBROVSKY ZIVTHAN; CHERNEY RAPHAEL; SALLUM HANI; DA SILVA GILLIG JULIAN
abstract_clean: A vertically driving marking robot includes a robot body; at least one magnet constraining the robot to move parallel to a vertical, magnetically responsive surface; a drive configured to displace the robot relative to the surface while the robot is held to the surface; a holder configured to hold a marker; an accelerometer measuring a gravity vector; a computing device in communication with the optical sensors, the accelerometer, and the drive. The computing device includes a processor and computer-readable memory, wherein the computer-readable memory includes non-transitory program code for at least one of the following actions: (a) generating a drift correction to compensate for drive slippage drift in response to and as a function of the gravity vector and (b) commanding the drive to displace the robot along a desired trajectory in response to the drift correction.

title: OBJECT PRODUCTION KIT
inventors: FERNANDO MONTEIRO DA CUNHA
abstract_clean: This invention patent is for a kit for producing objects, belonging to the technical toy sector, more particularly it is a kit for producing toys by the user himself, for fun and educational purposes, in the style of “maker” or “do it yourself” learning. The kit comprises a container that contains tools, decorative materials, electrical and electronic materials, and a printed circuit board used for programming. In addition to these materials, the box contains 12 cards with information about projects that can be carried out with the resources in the container. These cards contain a QR code that, when read with a mobile device, directs the user to the invention's website, containing additional information about the product and the object being created. The object production kit consists of a large container (1), with lid, equipped with an internal compartment (1'), with dividers (2), forming niches in which the following materials organized by category are added: Basic elements ( 3); Electrical and electronic materials (4); Programming materials (5); Decorative materials (6) and Guidance cards for assembling objects (7).

abstract_clean: kit and method for programming in a low-tech system. The present invention describes a kit and method for exercising/training/programming in a low-tech system. The kit is organized in a magnetized container with a board game, instructional manual, challenge cards, programming codes/algorithms and pawns/avatars for training in programming logic. In detail, the present invention is a magnetized container that includes a board, two dice, six pawns/avatars and sixty-five challenge cards with instructions for executing programming through sixty-three included algorithms/codes so that teams or single user carry out the programming/command described, enabling exercise/training/programming training in a low-tech system. The present invention is in the fields of board games using dice, pawns and cards, teaching elements, instructional elements, programming, coding, game accessories.

abstract_clean: The present invention describes a self-learning method composed of a network of digital creativity laboratories; exploration of internet of things and artificial intelligence; sustainable experiences and experiences; co-creation and socio-emotional security, with each of the aforementioned laboratories developing personalized self-learning trails that awaken, develop and transcend digital and behavioral transformations through the conscious use of technologies to construct their own knowledge and authorship.

title: EDUCATIONAL COMPUTER IN PHYSICAL BLOCKS
inventors: NEITON CARVALHO DA SILVA; GILBERTO AMADO DE AZEVEDO CYSNEIROS FILHO
abstract_clean: This invention is an Educational Computer in Physical Blocks that can develop computational algorithms in a handwritten form in physical blocks without the need for electrical energy. Assisting in the cognitive process of teaching computational learning and that can be applied as a school kit combating computational illiteracy and Computational Thinking with Block Programming (visual programming) can be applied to develop playful algorithms (colorful and embedded) being in compliance in several places such as: the National Common Curricular Base of Brazil, Common Core of the United States of America and also in the world that uses the K-12 method and model that is the American basic education and that today is replicated in the world. Thus being able to reach anyone even being in a remote place that has no electricity. The state of the art in which this invention can fit is in the field of education as an educational kit simulating a computer only by means of physical blocks, which can easily be replicated and distributed to society both industrially and manually and thus be able to reach even people in the most remote places by not needing electricity to learn the computational cognitive process.
